did.unittitle: 67th New York Infantry Regiment portrait album
did.abstract: The album consists of cartes-de-visite and tintypes showing officers of the 67th New York Infantry Regiment as well as other Union Army officers during the Civil War era. Individuals are identified in the album, and a name index is enclosed.

bioghist.head: Historical note
bioghist.p: The 67th New York Infantry Regiment, also known as the First Long Island Regiment and Beecher's Regiment, was active during the Civil War. The regiment was largely composed of Brooklyn residents.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: The 67th New York Infantry Regiment portrait album dates from circa 1862 to 1865 and contains 80 items. The album consists of cartes-de-visite and tintypes showing officers of the 67th New York Infantry Regiment as well as other Union Army officers during the Civil War era. Individuals are identified in the album, and a name index is enclosed.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Item-level description and digital versions of images from the collection are available for searching via the image database in the library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Fully processed to the item level. Album rehoused by John Zarrillo in August 2016.

relatedmaterial.p: Additional Civil War-related portraits are available in the Civil War veterans portrait albums, ARC.214.
